body_html:
• I tried to compile tensorflow from source in jetson tk1,
    i use external sd card for booting (32 GB), ubuntu 14.04. already install cuda 7.0 with cudnn 4 (for dummy while compiling), python 2.7.6, gcc 4.8.5, bazel 0.5.4-dist, GPU Model K20A and memory of Jetson only 2 GB

The steps are :
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
cd tensorflow
git checkout rv1.4.0
grep -Rl "lib64"| xargs sed -i 's/lib64/lib/g' bec ause jetson tk1 only support 32 bit
./configure
chose jemalloc and cuda support,with cuda sdk 7.0 and cudnn 4
bazel build --config=opt --config=cuda --local_resources 2048,.5,1.0 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

and the result shown above after compiling file around 3000 files

Thx

body:
- I tried to compile tensorflow from source in jetson tk1,
i use external sd card for booting (32 GB), ubuntu 14.04. already install cuda 7.0 with cudnn 4 (for dummy while compiling), python 2.7.6, gcc 4.8.5, bazel 0.5.4-dist, GPU Model K20A and memory of Jetson only 2 GB

The  steps are :
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
cd tensorflow
git checkout rv1.4.0
grep -Rl "lib64"| xargs sed -i 's/lib64/lib/g'  bec ause jetson tk1 only support 32 bit
./configure 
   chose jemalloc and cuda support,with cuda sdk 7.0 and cudnn 4
bazel build --config=opt --config=cuda --local_resources 2048,.5,1.0 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package 

and the result shown above after compiling file around 3000 files

Thx
